answers.answer: Hi,Your son is suffering from something known as polyuria and I’ll suggest to get him examined and rule out som of the common causes of the same, for e.g. diabetes mellitus,diabetes inspidus, urinary tract infection etc. Once these have been ruled out, then only it should be labeled as an obsessive compulsive disorder(a disease in which a person has an obsession of doing something and that obsession settles down only after the compulsive act of doing it). For this, you’ll need to consult a psychiatrist.I sincerely hope that helps. Please do keep me posted. Kind Regards.

question: My 11 year old son who has autism has developed an obsession with urinating.  He feels like he constantly has to go. This has been happening for over 2 years now but is getting worse.  He will go to the bathroom to void even minutes after just going.  Then he'll ask if he can go again.  It is worse at night when he is getting ready to go to bed and fall asleep.  This morning he got up four times in less than 5 minutes to go pee.  Is this somehow related to puberty?  How can we stop this anxiety and obsession?  PLEASE HELP!! It's driving us all crazy.  I'm also worried that he could somehow injure himself with this constant voiding.
title: obsession with urinating
